text: Tristan Tzara (; ; born Samuel or Samy Rosenstock, also known as S. Samyro; Hentea, pp. 1–2 – 25 December 1963) was an artist from Romania and France who was known for starting the Dadaist movement. He was interested in symbolism and was more on the nihilistic side of Dada than others. == References == Category:1896 births Category:1963 deaths Category:French art critics Category:20th-century French composers Category:French critics Category:French essayists Category:French movie directors Category:French poets Category:Jewish French musicians Category:Jewish French writers Category:Romanian composers Category:Romanian Jews Category:Romanian movie directors Category:Romanian writers
title: Tristan Tzara
